column5: You have success with many species or ya just bass fishing south?  I use these worms similar to a senko but I cant find that color here locally, i cant even remember who makes them? I think its Matzuo but it may be Lunkerhunter. I love em have like 20 packs lol
#2 for me would probably also be a jig and pig or jig and plastic, usually anything from 1/16th to 1 ounce, even small ones can catch outsized fish.
31/2in berkley ripple shad, smelt pattern.

Id probably take a TDD11 30 foot taildancer in clown...  I'd give up ice fishing to have the open water results of this lure...  I get loads of walleye on these... A fair amount of accidental musky... Plenty of smallies...  The only trip I do is quinte and they work there...  Great day or night color....  And I get walleye from opening day till ice up trolling these...
Chartreuse 1/8oz Northland Lipstick stand up jighead with a 3" white Powerbait Ribbontail grub.......  Burt

This spinnerbait, or one just like it. 10" crappie by accident, 20" largemouth, 34" pike, 46" tiger, 25" walleye are the big fish from the past 2 seasons on my spinnerbaits. Only targeting muskie and pike also.

For Musky - my go to lure us a Double Cowgirl.  Black with silver (or gold) blades. I probably thow this one lure 90+ percent of the time.  Still trying to catch one on the trolling baits Art had given to me.    One of these years, we'll get one on them.
This thread is gold  Now I need to learn how to use these baits.
Perrywinkle.
Perrywinkle. subtle
Red and white Mepps spinner.
Since I usually only chase musky I will be a double 10 Handlebarz disco inferno. Great for any colour water and pisses off them neutral musky.
I'd be in, now I just have to figure out what is my go to lure  Yes I'm quoting myself, but I figured out my go to lure, and it is a Red Erie Dearie 3/8 oz
1/4 ounce jig head weedless northland or reg with gamagatsu and a 4" gulp minnow! Catches fish !
Oops I realize it's only one. Weedless jig then
Mepps aglia in silver, #3.
Atlantic on a treble!  For a conventional lure probably a white spinnerbait with gold willow blades. For a fly an olive bugger.
Lipless crank. Catches everything.  And it works for lakers on the ice!
Len Thompson five of diamonds.  Catches everything and is cheap to buy.
Can't believe it took 3 pages for someone to mention this.  Good ole five n' diner can't be beat.  This lure is a Canadian classic.
White Big O crankbait----bass, pike ,walleye, even bows!
I girl I used to go to school with only uses that and swears by it. She says it outfishes everything.

Len Thompson five of diamonds. Catches everything and is cheap to buy.   Can't believe it took 3 pages for someone to mention this. Good ole five n' diner can't be beat. This lure is a Canadian classic.   I girl I used to go to school with only uses that and swears by it. She says it outfishes everything.  Sounds like i need to pick up a few of these
We did something similar to that a few years back. We had a Dollarama derby.
Single choice would be white jig and white twisters 1" -6" size, as so many others have stated.
My understanding is that what most of us refer to as the 5 of diamonds is more correctly called: red and yellow... or is it yellow and red.  Or maybe it's a ski-doo/snowmobile type of thing?

We should do it again. But different then the dollerama derby.  Any gear you choose but you have to use the lure mentioned in the thread.  Pats on the back for the biggest of each species. Then add the lengths up.  Whos go to lure is the best of the all lol
Another for a white 4"grub.  Icefishing ony its a #50 williams half an half hammered. Ive caught just about everything on it, and ALWAYS have one rigged....it actually never comes off that icerod.

My buddies and I have always talked about doing a three day trip where everyone only gets to bring one lure .... well, maybe a handful of the same lure.  We've never done it, but due to this thread we are gonna try it this year.  I LOVE the idea of a thread where the folks on here post pictures of fish they caught on their chosen lure .... it would be really fun to see how it plays out over the season.  I must admit though, the jig and twister crowd will most likely have the best results.
Phenix 2 1/2 inch smoke colored salted tube on a 1/8 or 1/16 ounce jighead...Bass think it's candy...
Tough question. I would probably say a 5 1/2 inch Smithwick Rogue in clown colour or Chartreuse spinnerbait or Black jig and pig or White grub
I thought you could only pick one! I think you be cheating ! Lol I'd hide the jig in my pocket
riplin redfin.  colour doesn't matter.
Original Rapala (balsa wood model not the new plastic model) Fat Rap in a crawdad color.

The bait that will catch the most fish day in and day out is a 5 inch Senko type worm. I want mine with a 3/0 EWG hook and if it's not cheating I'd like to carry a few split shot.  Surface lures are fun, but if that's all you got, there are going to be some long days. Crank baits and jerk baits are great, but there are summer days when you are going to retrieve move weeds than fish.  There's also the question of depth...unless you're throwing a sinking bait, you are stuck within a depth range.  Inline and bent wire baits and spoons have to be kept moving.  Anything that spins doesn't work that well around weeds, and on some days, the flash will put the fish down.  Jig are deadly, and would be my second choice.  The problem is I wouldn't want to be stuck with only one profile all season and everywhere...You can drag, hop or swim a jig, but if you're stuck with one profile and one weight /style of jig head this isn't going to allow that much versatility..  Enter the Mid-size worm either mid-brown or dark green.  It can be fished on top, in the middle or on the bottom.  The variations are almost endless... Move it fast, slow, or not at all. Hooked weedless or wacky or as a drop shot. Change the profile by splitting it in half length-wise for a finesse drop-shot. Bite off a chunk to reduce it's length and profile. Perhaps even add a second worm to bulk-it-up. Etc. etc. etc.
Like that 4" white grub too because of all the different fish it can catch but, make it a white bucktail jig and it's probably gonna be even better.  Especially with different trouts.

Enter the Mid-size worm either mid-brown or dark green.  It can be fished on top, in the middle or on the bottom.  The variations are almost endless... Move it fast, slow, or not at all. Hooked weedless or wacky or as a drop shot. Change the profile by splitting it in half length-wise for a finesse drop-shot. Bite off a chunk to reduce it's length and profile. Perhaps even add a second worm to bulk-it-up. Etc. etc. etc.  That's a pretty good analysis!  I think a good quality paddle tail swimbait would also be a good choice, using similar logic.

That's a pretty good analysis!  I think a good quality paddle tail swimbait would also be a good choice, using similar logic.  A paddle tail on a weedless bass jig, with a matching skirt would be an outstanding big fish bait.  Multi-species, weedless, fishes all depths.  Hop it, swim it, or drag it...The only short fall is size, half the time it will be too big or too small,.  You can cut some off or trim the skirt to make it look smaller,.  It needs to be moving to work the tail, but on a lot of days, it might be best.  Over the summer it might very well win weight, but not numbers.
Gary2rs was so convincing that I want to change my vote now. The senko would likely be the winner in a two day one lure tourney. I just get sick of fishing them. You can do almost anything with them.

Garry2s  Look on the first page at my post.  The reasons I chose that bait is because I can fish it numerous ways for a multitude of species. On ice or soft water.  Only difference between you and I is I chose a shakey head jig?

I'm going to use a split-shot right next to the knot when I want to do shaky head...grin. Speaking of shaky heads...Have you ever tried the Z-man baits? They float so the tail is always pointing up. I'm in Arizona and have been using their finesse worms on a 1/16th ball head jig with good results this winter.
crankbait would be a #5 silver shad rap jig= would be 3-4in white twister-tail/pink jig-head
Mine,sexy shad #5 I believe.The larger crankbait.Blue/white with a  yellow stripe down the side.Unbelievable on a regular basis
Chaetruse big o.   That catch's every species
Heddon Zara Spook.... Nothing better then a top water bite.
Easy choice for me, Mepps Black Fury #5 It has probably caught me over a dozen species big and small.
Rapala, jointed in chartreuse
4 inch Live Target Perch
Live Target jointed smelt
crankbait would be a #5 silver shad rap jig= would be 3-4in white twister-tail/pink jig-head  I thought you could only pick one! I think you be cheating ! Lol
I don't know why anyone would play such a cruel and unusual game as this but I'd go brown twistertail on a jig as well.
Heddon Zara Spook.... Nothing better then a top water bite.  On top is best but it's tough to get one down the icehole though.

My own answer is very similar to that of Fishing Fury.  I'd go with a Mepps Black Fury #3, with the yellow spots.  It's been deadly for me over the years and produced a surprising amount of species as well.
This is the best thread ever to get to know everyones "secret weapons" lol   And it`s not the first time it`s been asked....oh and mine would be the Yumbrella...so good it`s been banned!!!
This... It's a shallow diver. It has caught me rainbows, browns, smallmouth, largemouth, crappies... Since I mostly fish from shore, shallow diving is usually key.
Surprised nobody said white spinnerbait yet lol. On softwater thatll catch ya lots as well, just not on the hardwater.  I picked mine based on any scenario, any season or species
almost time to rebuild the tackle box

I don't know why anyone would play such a cruel and unusual game as this but I'd go brown twistertail on a jig as well.  Just wait until I challenge everyone to use their mentioned lure as their only artificial bait for one full year of fishing.
That would be a fun thread!  Post your pics of fish caught on the lure you chose in this thread!

Being a trout nut I would have to say the good old Little Cleo 1/4 or 1/3 oz. I have caught every trout that swims in my neck woods with it plus salmon, bass and pike. Works good under the ice as well.

Just wait until I challenge everyone to use their mentioned lure as their only artificial bait for one full year of fishing.  So would you have to use it while ice fishing?  That would be a fun thread!  Post your pics of fish caught on the lure you chose in this thread!  I'd be in, now I just have to figure out what is my go to lure
Mag Black Bulldawg
Mepps # 2 or 3
rapala J 7 or 9 in chartreuse or black/gold......caught everything on these

Stick of dynamite?  Just kidding, jig with pearl thumper tail/twister tail. Why that is the lure of choice down in Louisiana. Since we are up North a little my choice is the wacky rigged senco with a jighead.   Art
$1000.00 bill. Might not catch me any fish but I'd sure have a lot of fun!

I was going to ask Chris K this on our next long drive to our ice fishing  destination but figured I would let everyone chime in.  If you were told you were only allowed to use one artificial fishing bait, in one colour (you can use different sizes) what would it be?  For me, I would have to go with a crayfish coloured crank bait. For years, my top brand would be the Rebel one that swims backwords but as of recent I think I would take the Live target one in dark brown. It means I would have to ice fish with only minnows and a hook from now on, but the number of Bass, Walleye and Pike I land off of that crank over the summer make up for it.  How about you guys? No loopholes, just one artificial bait, one colour, one brand.
Yellow 1/4oz twister tail jig. It will catch pretty much anything that swims.
For largemouth bass?   http://zoombait.com/worms/swimming-tails/u-tails/   With only one choice for other species I would stay home and cut grass.

1/4 ounce northland shakeyhead jig with a 6" pumpkin/fleck senko.  I can even ice fish with it?  Jig it, swim it, fish it weedless/snagless, and wacky rig it?  Caught tons of fish the past two to three years doing all these, especially pike, walleye and smallies. I can trim the worm, its deadly on crappie as well.
Black spinner bait with a red tail behind it.
can use different sizes, but only one colour?  I'd say a chartreuse jig head with a yellow grub on it
Black Bulldawg
Finesse Minnow or Shad...Arkansas Shiner color. Has caught me every species....some accidental...of gamefish and panfish that swim in the waters I fish.
white twister hands down.
white twister hands down.  Yupp, white twister green head...maybe even a double tail
rasta 1/2oz spinner bait.  ive caught 22 inch walleye, largies, smallies, and loads of pike on it.
Husky jerk hj11 in brown back/orange belly or yellow jig head with chartreuse twister tail.  Can't decide witch.
Gold and silver hammer plate williams whitfish.
This is the best thread ever to get to know everyones "secret weapons" lol
A big ole #950 Grim Reaper spinnerbait, black with orange blades and a 7" orange worm hanging off the side of it.  Never met any self respecting musky that could resist it.
Banjo Minnow. Really a Black and silver metal flake Rappala F-9 would be my #1 choice.
White twister on a jig head for me as well, in 3, 4, 6 and 8" sizes. Would catch everything. A jig in general is the most versatile bait possible, so it's an easy choice when you can only pick one.
You found out my plan! Lol.
Stick of dynamite?  Just kidding, jig with pearl thumper tail/twister tail.
marshmellow treble
FinS fish and jig combo I guess.
White twister on a jighead for me to. I throw lots of stuff, but that catches almost everything in the lake.

In various sizes, I could catch just about anything with a basic in-line spinner.  I really like the blue and silver.  They are incredibly simple and easy to fish .... you can count them down to any depth, troll them, and even slow roll them on the bottom.
white twister hands down. X2..
